title: Kellogg Workers Stay on Strike After Rejecting Tentative Agreement
sub_head: About 1,400 workers have been on strike for two months, demanding better pay and enhanced benefits
body:
About 1,400 Kellogg Co. workers rejected a tentative agreement between their union and the cereal company, extending a strike at four plants where Frosted Flakes, Froot Loops and other consumer brands are made.
Kellogg said Tuesday that it was disappointed the agreement was rejected and that it planned to hire full-time employees to replace the ones that are striking.
